description: A comprehensive online map can be found: hereThis map shows all existing Trail Heads and Trails, each shown in different colors. These correspond with the colored markers that can be found on the trails. Brief descriptions of each trail are also provided under the map.SUMMIT TRAIL - Difficult Hike (Time= 1hr 29min, Length=5.2km, Elevation change=485m)This challenging trail is perfect for those looking for a workout; it has the most elevation gain to the peak of Spion Kop. You?ll enjoy several cool forested areas and pass under a spectacular basalt cliff near the top. Follow the red markers until near the top where it joins Tower Trail (White) to the summit.[Spion Kop Summit]You made it! Views of the Central Okanagan Valley unfold below you with unparalleled views of Kalamalka Lake all the way around the compass points to Terrace Mountain. Try the different views from each of the basalt outcroppings of the summit of Spion Kop - you deserve it.NOTE: Pay attention to the trail markers. Any trails with two colored markers are "connector" trails between main trails using the colors of those main trails.Directions to PELMEWASH TRAIL HEADFrom Highway 97, take the Pelmewash Parkway exit (300m past Oceola intersection). Follow Pelmewash Parkway for approx. 3.5 kms and look for a park bench and WALC (Walk Around Lake Country) trail head sign on left side. Park on the Wood Lake side of the road. The Summit Trail is identified with red markers.
title: Spion Kop SUMMIT TRAIL
